meanings.definition: The quality or state of being indeterminate.
meanings.sent1: The indeterminacies in the weather forecast made it hard to plan a picnic.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often encounter indeterminacies when studying complex systems.
meanings.sent3: The indeterminacies in the magician's trick left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The indeterminacies of the plot kept the readers guessing until the very end.
meanings.sent5: The indeterminacies of the maze confused the participants during the race.

meanings.sent1: The indeterminacies in the measurements led to inaccurate results.
meanings.sent2: The indeterminacies in the map caused us to take the wrong turn.
meanings.sent3: The indeterminacies in the recipe resulted in a surprisingly delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The indeterminacies in the painting gave it a unique and abstract quality.
meanings.sent5: The indeterminacies in the instructions made it challenging to assemble the furniture.

meanings.sent1: The indeterminacies of the stock market make it a risky investment.
meanings.sent2: The indeterminacies of life keep things interesting and exciting.
meanings.sent3: The indeterminacies of the game added an element of suspense for the players.
meanings.sent4: The indeterminacies of the outcome left everyone on edge.
meanings.sent5: The indeterminacies of the situation made it difficult to make a decision.
